intro: Beyeria lasiocarpa f. denudata, commonly known as the naked-stemmed beyeria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its slender, often leafless stems. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered with fine, silky hairs. This variant is distinguished by its reduced foliage compared to the typical form of Beyeria lasiocarpa.
